    • Method Detail

      • getBatchBugParameters

        java.util.List<BugParam> getBatchBugParameters​(UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Used by the framework to know the list of bug parameters this plugin needs to submit batch bugs. Provides default or null values.

        The BugTrackerPlugin.setConfiguration(java.util.Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Parameter choice lists and defaults can be made dynamic by having the implementation go to the bug tracking system to determine list of valid choices

        Parameters:
        credentials - bug tracker credentials supplied by the user
        Returns:
        list of parameter objects. These value fields in the objects need to be initialized with null. The identifier field must be unique across all of these objects
        Throws:
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system

      • onBatchBugParameterChange

        java.util.List<BugParam> onBatchBugParameterChange​(java.lang.String changedParamIdentifier,
                                                   java.util.List<BugParam> currentValues,
                                                   UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Given that the user changed the value of a parameter on the UI, this method fetches the updated choice list for other batch bug parameters

        The BugTrackerPlugin.setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        If BugParamChoice.getHasDependentParams() attribute of a plugin's bug parameter is marked as true, then this method will be called whenever the parameter's value changes in the UI layer.

        Tips and Gotchas:

        • Act on each bug parameter that has dependent parameters
        • Do not forget handling case when param value changes to null (no selection made)
        • Do not forget to set the param value in return list to null when its choices change
        • When adding new parameters, ensure that it is not already present in the return list
        • Return null if there is no change
        • Use one of these strategies (a) Modify currentValues parameter and return it (b) Construct the return value from raw params maintained. Set values and choice lists before returning

        Parameters:
        changedParamIdentifier - the identifier of BugParam whose value changed on the UI
        currentValues - all of the BugParams and their current values
        credentials - bug tracker credentials supplied by the user
        Returns:
        modified list of bug parameters with updated choice lists. UI will be updated according to this list. Return null for no changes (performance optimization).
        Throws:
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user

      • fileMultiIssueBug

        Bug fileMultiIssueBug​(MultiIssueBugSubmission bug,
                      UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        File bugs containing multiple issues on the bug tracking system.

        The BugTrackerPlugin.setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Tips and Gotchas:

        • The summary and description from the MultiIssueBugSubmission.getIssueDetails() are provided by SSC. They are not the user supplied values. If you added summary and description as bug parameters, use the bug.getParams() to retrieve the user supplied values.
        • Use fields in MultiIssueBugSubmission.getIssueDetails(), namely getLastBuildWithoutIssue(), getDetectedInBuild() and getFileName() to perform changeset discovery if you have access to your repository

        Parameters:
        bug - value object that has details of the content that needs to go into the bug.
        credentials - bug tracker system credentials to use
        Returns:
        a result object encapsulating the bug details.
        Throws:
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system
